metadata.title: CVE-2016-9772 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
OpenAFS 1.6.19 and earlier allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive directory information via vectors involving the (1) client cache partition, (2) fileserver vice partition, or (3) certain RPC responses.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2016-9772` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libafsauthent2 - 1.6.20-1
libafsrpc2 - 1.6.20-1
libkopenafs2 - 1.6.20-1
openafs-client - 1.6.20-1
openafs-dbserver - 1.6.20-1
openafs-fileserver - 1.6.20-1
openafs-fuse - 1.6.20-1
openafs-krb5 - 1.6.20-1
openafs-modules-dkms - 1.6.20-1
openafs-modules-source - 1.6.20-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openafs package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.20-1').
